CatDescriptText: Cropped image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 20, 1950, pg. 1. Portions of accompany article read: "Death Takes Jerry Talbot - Jerry Talbot, 79, a citizen of Pittsburgh for more than fifty years, died at his home, 5635 Mignonette Street, Saturday, May 13, less than six months after the celebration of his golden wedding anniversary. Last rites were conducted in Gaines Funeral Chapel Tuesday, May 16, by the Rev. S. A. Thurston.  The Rev. Ernest Watson assisted.  Mr. Talbot was born in Forest Depot, Bedford County Va., and came to Pittsburgh in 1894....  In 1899 the deceased married Miss Carrie Payne and of this union five children were born, three survive. Distinguished Family - The Talbot family has lived in the East End District for fifty years.  The children are well known. Mrs. Helen Talbot Franklin was graduated from Howard University and is now on the staff of the State Department of Public Assistance.  Reginald was graduated from the University of Pittsburgh and is a contractor, and Dr. Walter R. received his Doctor of Philosophy degree from the University of Pittsburgh at the age of 24.  He heads the Department of Mathematics at Lincoln University , Jefferson City, Mos.  Retired Foreman - Mr. Talbot was a construction foreman for the Booth and Flinn Company, and later was at the John F. Casey Company, in Aspinwall.  He retired in 1939 due to ill health, but later resumed private work.  Surviving besides the three children are a widow, Mrs. Carrie Talbot, and two grandchildren, Marjorie Franklin and John Franklin Jr."
TitMainTitle: Carrie Talbot holding bouquet of dollar bills, and Jerry Talbot holding box, seated on sofa, possibly for fiftieth anniversary celebration, in their home at 5635 Mignonette Street, East Liberty, another version
